alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 12:02PM CDT until March 27 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Douglas, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported numerous flooded roadways from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Up to an additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain are expected through this afternoon, leading to continued flooding. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bryant Creek at Highway U, Cowskin Creek at Highway Y, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447, Wolf Creek at Highway AB and Fox Creek at County Road 246. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
